statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: NC Greensboro 76, Greensboro 67
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. (AP) -- Chris Chalko scored 21 points, including a tiebreaking three-pointer that put Elon in the lead for good with 2:44 remaining on the way to an 87-82 win over UNC-Greensboro on Saturday. Chalko went five-of-10 from three-point range for the Phoenix (14-13, 10-4 Southern Conference). Scottie Rice added 18 points, and LeVonn Jordan added 11. Ricky Hickman had a career-high 34 points for the Spartans (11-18, 4-10) as he went 7-of-13 from three-point range. He set a school record by scoring in double digits for his 27th straight game. Kyle Hines added 18 points and Devin Boddie had 10 for UNC-Greensboro. The teams kept it tight for most of the game, with six ties and seven lead changes throughout. Elon shot 48 percent to the Spartans' 42.3 percent in the first half for a 38-35 halftime lead. The Phoenix picked it up to 63.6 percent to UNCG's 57.7 percent in the second half. Elon opened up its largest lead of the afternoon at 66-60 when UNCG called a timeout with 6:28 to play. The Spartans then fought back with an 11-5 spurt to tie the game 71-71 with 3:15 remaining, but Chalko's three-pointer put the Phoenix on a 9-2 run that broke the game open.
